fields.description:
We get the following set of messages for 7 unrecognised email addresses repeating every 2 minutes.

2005-08-08 16:31:50,649 WARN [service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler] The mail 'FROM' does not match a valid user
2005-08-08 16:31:50,650 WARN [service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler] This user is not in jira so can not add a comment: Firstname Lastname <email@address.com>

After talking to two of the people whose names display in the log it appears that these people sent replies to jira@ our domain without realising they were emailing JIRA (thinking they were replying to an actual person who logged the original ticket, or in one case a postmaster@domain automated reply at a guess).

Several questions arise from this.

1) Is there a way to configure outgoing emails so the From field just says JIRA instead of listing the user creating/updating/commenting on issues?

2) What is the expected behaviour of JIRA if it receives an email it doesn't recognise in the following cases?  
- email from a known user and no issue reference
- email from an unknown user and no issue reference
- email from an unknown user and does contain an issue reference (but no anon/public access to comment is set)

3) Where/how can I track down these incoming emails which appear to have stuck themselves somewhere and are repeatedly filling up our log files (4MB of logs in three days)

Thanks!
fields.summary: Comments via email sent to JIRA from unknown jira user clogging log file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7582].
  {panel}

We have a custom field that is of number type. Two problems:

  1. When the field is printed out it gets printed with commas. So 1234 would become 1,234. Is there a way to disable this?

  2. Entering data in the field does not permit commas. This is a strange inconsistency - I can't copy-paste a number from one form to another.

Jira needs to pick which way it wants to go on printing/accepting commas in its custom number fields. I'd recommend getting rid of it entirely, as it's very distracting when we use it for build numbers or changelist numbers.

h3. Workaround
* [Using Workflow 'Regular Expression Check' Validator to Restrict Text Field in Number Format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Using+Workflow+%27Regular+Expression+Check%27+Validator+to+Restrict+Text+Field+in+Number+Format]
fields.summary: Inconsistency in rendering of number fields

fields.description:
There are a few things that need to be done before JIRA can move to a new user management system:

- Introduce a 'JiraUserManager' that should be used for all user-related functions
- Remove all static calls to UserManager.getInstance() and UserUtils.

Later
- Wrap all calls to User to go through 'JiraUser'
fields.summary: Prepare JIRA for move to new User Management System

fields.description:
In 2.5.3, if you released a version, and there were still unresolved issues, there was a wizard step to "move" them to another unreleased version...

This seems to have disappeared in 3.2.3... so we are now getting changelogs with unresolved issues in them (which isnt too good)
fields.summary: It seems you can now release a version, even though there are unresolved issues assigned to it

fields.description:
While it is nice to have the Notification Schemes, there is a bizarre behavior as far as I understand it.
Lets say that "Issue Updated" is set to notify " Current Assignee and Reporter ".  however, it makes NO sense that when the Assignee himself updates the issue (lets say he adds a comment, or changes the component) he gets 5 seconds later an email! 
The solution is not to remove the Current Assignee from the notification scheme since he still wants to get emails when someone ELSE makes an update...
fields.summary: Smart Notification: avoid notifying the person doing the action

fields.description: There is no documentation that explains what the consequences are of JIRA not having access to the local disk. I assume that attachments cannot be stored and searching won't work. The resolution to this issue should either be to improve the documentation or supply a switch that will automatically shut JIRA down if it can't get to the local disk. A third option would be to send a distress email to the admin if the local disk can't be reached.
fields.summary: Document consequences if JIRA cannot access local disk.
user browser filter by no group

fields.description:
I have a big project with a lot of component (over 200) .. i want to be able to import easily  a component list for this project .. 
... easily means that i don't want to  walk over each component to set the component leader or the detail information ...  :-)

I tried to use CSV import but component leader or detail information can't be reached !
Documentation for Jelly importer talk about a jelly tag (jira:AddComponent) but i can't see how to update the compnent leader field ...
fields.summary: CSV importing or Jelly importing does'nt allow to create completely a component (csv : no Detail information , no Component lead) , (jelly ... component lead cannot be set )

fields.description:
At the moment the CSV Documentation does not explain field mappings very well. Especially with the 'Import as Blank' Option.

From a support email:
"When importing the CSV file containing our defect data, I populated the
resolution field incorrectly.  When I mapped our string resolutions (fixed,
cancelled, etc) with the pull down list in the importer, I left the items
that I wanted to keep open as "No Mapping" instead of "Enter as Blank".
This caused problems in the database because the items that I had mapped
were entered as their numerical ID for the status, and the items I had
selected as "No Mapping" had their strings in the table instead of the
blank I had wanted.  On the list of issues, these issues with incorrect
resolutions were listed as "UNRESOLVED", however they did not appear in any
of the "Open Issue" lists.  When I went back and reimported the data with
the "Enter as Blank" everything worked fine."
fields.summary: Improve doc on mapping field values for CSV

fields.description:
Cannot search with Korean alphabet on Summary or Description.
I tested on my own test configuration and your Jira test project site too.

Please refer to the attachment.
fields.summary: Cannot search with Korean alphabet on Summary or Description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7571].
  {panel}

At the moment when a screen is shown to a user, JIRA uses fields default values on issue creation and currently set values on all other screens (e.g. edit screens, and workflow transition screens).

Sometimes it is desirable to configure what the values that will be  shown on each screen are. We can do this in several ways:
- alllow to cofnigure field defualts per screen
- introduce a new plugin type that is called before each screen initialisation
- allow to supply javascript that runs on screen load

For a sample use case see JRA-7456
fields.summary: Introduce screen initialisation plugin point

fields.description: Document JRA-7041 Notifications base on a user custom field
fields.summary: Document JRA-7041 Notifications base on a user custom field

fields.description: Currently there is no tooltip of the parents summary for subtasks due to performance issues.
fields.summary: Add parent issues summary as tooltip for subtasks

fields.description:
The "Show Saved Filter" portlet is nice, but it would be much better if we could customize the fields it shows. I see issue type, and priority, but I'd like to add resolution.

Ideally would be something closer to the issue navigator config page, but that might be overkill. Perhaps instead just a little set of checkboxes on the portlet config page for some hard coded fields we can decide to turn on or off?

At minimum I'd just like the resolution field. :)
fields.summary: Add more options to portlets letting me customize what columns are available etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7567].
  {panel}

Consider this situation:

  1. Bug is filed against version x, bug is fixed and closed.
  2. Version x ships and is eventually archived.
  3. A month later, bug is reopened on a new version - it's a regression.
  4. Test lead wants to update the version in the issue to point at the new version - it doesn't work!

Here's what happens: editing "Affects Version" simply adds the new version, but there is no ability to remove the old version. The only workaround is to temporarily unarchive that version so it shows up in the listbox, then edit again, deselect and save, then archive the version again.

I'm not sure what a good solution is. It's nice not having those archived versions showing up in the listbox. And if we pick a new version some people may want the archived version removed (as I do), whereas others may think it should be added.
fields.summary: Not possible to remove an archived version from an issue

fields.description: When clicking 'View & Hide', the 'Manage' link floats outside the search box. See screenshot.
fields.summary: UI problem on issue navigator when 'view & hide' selected

fields.summary: NullPointerException when using "Reported By Me" preset filter

fields.description:
The entity engine cannot create the table "version" on the database system maxDB, because a table with the name "version" exists in maxDB system tables.  

The restore of a jira backup file on a clear database will be end with errors, because JIRA cannot insert data into table "version"!

Edit: The procedure for correcting the problem needs to be documented.
fields.summary: Support for MySQL maxDB - Documentation
Cascade Select fields can not be used in statistics protlets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7561].
  {panel}

When we clone an open issue with closed subtasks, the clone is not correct since the status of the cloned subtasks is no longer "closed" but "open".

Is it a bug ?

Thanks

Cécile Gorin
fields.summary: Provide option to leave subtasks closed when cloning issue with subtasks

fields.description:
We are going to downgrade our licence from Professional to Standard. We are currently using only one feature of Professional: sub-tasks. Is it possible to convert them into regular tasks, for example by editing backup xml file before data migration? 

Standard version doesn't have sub-tasks, so it is not possible search this issues according to its type.
fields.summary: How to transform sub-tasks to tasks when downgrading from Professional to Standard?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7559].
  {panel}

Need to write a doc that answers the following query:

I have a question about the way to extend Jira. I have modified some files and I would like to know if my process is correct. 
I use Jira Enterprise 3.2.3 in the standalone version. To extend Jira, I have modified 1 java file (ViewVoters.java) and 2 other files (viewvoters.jsp and userselectnoheader.jsp). 
I modified viewvoters.jsp and userselectnoheader.jsp directly into the relevant directories (atlassian-jira/secure/views/issue and atlassian-jira/template/standard). 
For ViewVoters.java, I downloaded the Jira source files, I modified my file and with maven I compiled the source (maven jar). Then I copied the ViewVoters.class file from the "target/classes/..." directory into the "atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/..." directory.  
My question is : is it the good way to proceed ? (because when you will deliver the 3.2.4 release I will have to update all those files plus additional .vm files that I have already customized)
fields.summary: Write documentation on porting custom changes from one JIRA version to the next
Document how to internationalise plugins.

fields.description: The editsubtask jsp is not setting the form to be of type multipart which means that if the attachment field is set to show on the create and edit pages that attachments will not upload correctly from this page.
fields.summary: Can not attach files on the create subtask page when attachments have been setup to show on that screen.

fields.description: In issue JRA-7234, the portlets have been ordered by key, which is better than randomly. This request is to allow the user to configure the portlet to sort by some other column(s). What I had in mind was to be able to sort by "Updated" descending, since it would be handy to see the most recently updated issues that I am watching or voted for at the top of my list.
fields.summary: allow sorting of watches and votes portlets

fields.description:
I am accustomed to exporting my issue list to Excel and then re-ordering the columns as I wanted them within Excel. Due to the bug JRA-7454, I cannot get JIRA to sort it for me. Frustrating as anything - that one is -- I hope it's really fixed in 3.3.

Anyway, within Excel I used to be able to get around that by removing the picture and lines 1-6 and the last line (generated by...) leaving only a header row and the data. Now, I get an error from Excel when I try to sort:
"This operation requires the merged cells to be identically sized."
http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;813974

After some research, it appears that the "Components" column is the source of the trouble - I never used that column before. It creates an additional row for each issue that applies to more than one component.
Do you have any suggestions as to how to easily unmerge the cells as a workaround? And would you agree, this is not desirable behaviour in the first place?
I've attached a sample excel report produced from the test project. Look at rows 3-4 and 9-10.
I am guessing version info and perhaps other fields might act similarly. thx.
fields.summary: excel output can't be sorted when components is a column
Search does not query worklog text

fields.description:
Discovered an odd problem with Jira: 
If some part of issue id in the subject line falls on the 65th character, it inserts a space and creates a new issue. This is not, however, a strict size limitation, as the subject line is never cut, and if you insert issue id after that position (say, starting with 70th character), everything works just fine.
fields.summary: JIRA create new issue if old issue number falls on 65th character in subject line

fields.description: It would be nice to store separately the date an issue is resolved (and closed for that matter).  Update the find functionality to search by these status change dates.  Update date along with resolved/closed status works most of the time... but can get trickey if a resolved or closed issue is commented (thus updating the date stamp).
fields.summary: Provide capability to find issues by resolution date

fields.description:
It doesnt support a large number of custom field types - but this is the most glaring.
Some of the other simple ones should be available as well (like read-only text)
fields.summary: CSV importer doesnt support TextArea (long text) custom field type
after creating a permission scheme open the Edit Permissions page of the new scheme

fields.description:
Menubar is rendered taller in Opera than in IE or FF; menu positions remain partially highlighted even de-focused - see screenshot.

andy.
fields.summary: Broken menubar highlighting in Opera 8.x

fields.description:
We use the local filesystem on our server for CVS so that CVS is setup under /usr/local/cvs. When we start Jira it works fine showing files in CVS committed with the issue id. However, after a day or two it inevitably stops working. After checking /usr/local/jira/temp I can see that it stops working because a dangling cvslog.write.lock is left there. To fix the problem I have to remove the lock file and restart Jira. 

Any idea what might be causing that cvslog.write.lock to get left around instead of cleaned up? There's nothing in any of the log files are the time the lock file was created so I'm a bit perplexed.
fields.summary: Hanging cvslog.write.lock stopping Jira from updating CVS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7544].
  {panel}

{panel:title=22nd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}
It would be useful if the backup service had an option to delete backups older than X days.  This would prevent backups directories from filling up hard disks and causing chaos.
fields.summary: Provide backup service option to delete old backups

fields.description: When I log time in Jira it drops the stuff it doesn't understand. So for example if I log "1h30m" it just logs 1 hour and discards the 30minutes. I would prefer, that if Jira doesn't recognize the format I've put the text in that it give me an error and the opportunity to correct it.
fields.summary: When logging work Jira drops time when it doesn't understand the format instead of giving an error

fields.description: We've upgraded from 3.0.3 to 3.2.3 by pointing JIRA to  the old database. When we add/modify/update new issues, none of these changes show up in any  Preset Filters,search in the issue navigator, in the roadmap . Only the modifications from before the upgrade show up in the Preset Filter, search or roadmap.
fields.summary: Filters do not include any new modifications after upgrade from 3.0.3

fields.description:
Just wondering why, when I enter "     5 spaces" it displays as " 1 space".
Here's the above text using "-" where I have a space:
Just wondering why, when I enter "-----5 spaces" it displays as "-1 space".
fields.summary: extra spaces are trimmed when displaying text of issue

fields.description: very ugly
fields.summary: typing an invalid issue key in quick search results in an npe.

fields.description: Drop-down list of months is cropped to fit inside window area as you can see in attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Calendar window is too small for list of months

fields.description:
It seems that:
1) definition of 'calendar-pl-utf8.js' is obsolete; english version has newer fields
2) 'calendar-pl.js' encoded to ascii has probably UTF-16 encoding instead of UTF-8 and renders invalid fonts in calendar window.

andy.
fields.summary: Invalid calendar internationalization (polish, pl)

fields.description:
Hi,
we work since aprox. 30 days with jira. We still have a big problem. At daytime everything works fine, but at the next morning we are not able to connect via the web interface. The jira java process 
(tomcat) is still running and background processes, like CVS is still up and running. But all tomcat applications are not responding. Also we installed the manager and admin application on the tomcat. 
But there are also not responding at next morning. So every morning we need to restart the tomcat server. We increased the number of http connectors but it doesn't worked. We switched the SQL Server
connection to another server, but it also doesn't worked.
Do you have any suggestion about this problem?

Best regards 
Jörg Plümacher


Organisation  ORAYLIS GmbH  
Date Purchased  24.07.05  
License Type  JIRA Professional: Commercial Server  
Support Period  Your commercial JIRA support and updates are available until 25.07.06.  

--Professional Edition, Version: 3.2.2-#
fields.summary: no response via webinterface after several hours

fields.description:
It is no longer possible to set a default value for the version picker custom field.

The select list only has 'None' as an option.
fields.summary: Custom Fields - unable to set default value for version picker

fields.description: If something goes wrong with the CSV importer (eg. the .csv file is not readable by the JIRA user), then a CsvImportException is thrown.  The CsvImportException is then swallowed a few frames down, and not a hint reaches the user that anything went wrong, unless they notice that fewer than usual issues were imported.
fields.summary: No error handling in CSV importer when unable to read file

fields.description:
Have the ability to define a filter and specify what values the user should be queried for at run-time.

E.g. Have a filter that retreives all Unresolved issues for a user.  When a person selects this filter, they prompted to select a user to run the filter for.  Once this is entered teh filter is run with this value.

E.g. 2 
Assigned issues to me for a project.  When a user selects this filter, they are prompted for a project to run this against.  Once the project is entered, the filter is run against that project.

You should be able to enter multiple parameters to prompt for.  E.g reporter and status

This would allow for more flexible filters and would provide a cleaner interface to the end user for common searches.

Subscriptions may cause issues.
fields.summary: Filters to define and accept run-time parameters

fields.description:
On the browse project page, clicking the link to show unassigned issues does not filter by the current project; e.g.

secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?assigneeSelect=unassigned&sorter/field=priority&resolutionIds=-1&mode=hide&reset=true&sorter/order=ASC

it should be 

secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?assigneeSelect=unassigned&sorter/field=priority&resolutionIds=-1&mode=hide&reset=true&sorter/order=ASC&pid=(current PID)

This only affects the unassigned link, the others are just fine.
fields.summary: unassigned issues link from browse project broken
Ability to sort projects in order other than alphabetical

fields.description: We frequently use Xplanner in projects because of its superior (and simple!) iteration management functionality. Naturally, we tend to have most of the tasks replicated between task management in jira and iteration planning/management in xplanner. If jira had just a little better iteration planning, management and reporting, we wouldn't need to use Xplanner and we would be saved the hassle of managing/using two different task-tracking systems for the same tasks.
fields.summary: XPlanner-style iteration management / planning / progress reports
Selecting an item in the "Find Issues" filter which opens a window, may not open on the same monitor.

fields.description:
In the workflow post function view screen, if the resolution of an issue is set to 'None', the description appears as follows:

 The Resolution of the issue will be set to .

The description should be completed to say that the resolution is not set or set to 'None'.
fields.summary: Workflow Post Function - if resolution is set to 'None' - the description is not completed.

fields.description:
The qrtz_triggers table contains a row for every subscribed-to filter subscription:

10410 | SUBSCRIPTION_10360 | SEND_SUBSCRIPTION | 10000 | 2005-08-01 00:55:42.887-05 | WAITING       | SIMPLE       | 2005-02-16 23:55:42.887-06 |
...

The numeric part of the second field ('10360') is a reference to the id of a filtersubscription row (see DefaultSubscriptionManager#getSubscription where this is called).

In many JIRA databases though, I have found quartz triggers referring to nonexistent filtersubscriptions, as shown by this query (here on jira.atlassian.com data):

atlassian-jira=# select TRIGGER_NAME FROM qrtz_triggers LEFT JOIN filtersubscription ON filtersubscription.id=SUBSTRING(TRIGGER_NAME, 14) WHERE filtersubscription.id IS NULL;
    trigger_name    
--------------------
 SUBSCRIPTION_10340
 SUBSCRIPTION_10170
 SUBSCRIPTION_10280
 SUBSCRIPTION_10050
 SUBSCRIPTION_10060
 SUBSCRIPTION_10040
 SUBSCRIPTION_10410
 SUBSCRIPTION_10400
 SUBSCRIPTION_10080
 SUBSCRIPTION_10380

When these quartz jobs run, the following error appears in the logs (from JIRA 3.2):

INFO: Job SEND_SUBSCRIPTION.SEND_SUBSCRIPTION threw a JobExecutionException:
org.quartz.JobExecutionException: Error retrieving schedule entry for this job. [See nested exception: java.lang.NullPointerException: ]
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.subscription.SendFilterJob.execute(SendFilterJob.java:27)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
* Nested Exception (Underlying Cause) ---------------
java.lang.NullPointerException:
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.subscription.DefaultSubscriptionManager.runSubscription(DefaultSubscriptionManager.java:140)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.subscription.SendFilterJob.execute(SendFilterJob.java:23)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
fields.summary: Database inconsistency: quartz triggers referring to nonexistent filtersubscriptions, leads to JobExecutionException error in logs
Index who votes on and watches an issue - to allow for searching issues that you have voted on or are watching
Turn permission and notification types into plugins
Turn services and listeners into plugins
Upgrade sitemesh to a released version (version 2.3 most probably)
Maintain backwards compatibility by using a filter to rewrite issue navigator parameters.

fields.description:
when I have added a comment in which there are several chinese words quoted by chinese quotes, weirdly all of the words from the first quote to the end of line were replaced by a string of english quotes.

the attached pics would say it well. for convenience, there is also a attached text file for reproducing.
fields.summary: the quoted string with chinese quotation displayed weirdly in comment

fields.description: As you can see in the screenshot, I had voted for issue JRA-699. So, it shows up on my "My Votes" portlet. Now, you've gone ahead and resolved it. Which is great, only I can't unvote for it, so it will forever stay on my portlet. The only solution I can see is to change the My Votes portlet to not display resolved issues.
fields.summary: my votes portlets shows resolved issues

fields.description:
When at the JIRA doc page, http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.2/projects.html#versions, I clicked in the address bar, went to the end of url, and backspaced once too many times.  This left http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.2/index.htm in the address bar.  When I typed k rather than l and hit enter I got

500 Internal Server Error
More than 10 loops - erroring out.

Perhaps this should bring up the home page of the help system.
fields.summary: More than 10 loops - erroring out.

fields.description: Currently they grow without bound, and its starting to look ugly.
fields.summary: Improve the way that versions are handled within a project

fields.description:
At the momnet the functional tests are held in an external module. We need to move them into the jira source tree such that they get tagged and branched properly.

We also need to ensure that they are released with every source release. This could have a problem with licensing..... need to ensure that customers can run tests with their license.
fields.summary: Move functional tests to the jira source tree

fields.description: In certain circumstances the invalid characters were not stripped from the XML export
fields.summary: Invalid Characters were not stripped in 3.1.1

fields.description: I have translated the text for the property timetracking.field.description and environment.field.description  (in language_de_DE.jar) but when entering a new issue the english default text is displayed instead of the german one.
fields.summary: localisation problems in Create Issue page

fields.description: During move issue, the issue does not adpot the default security level in the target project if one is defined for that project.
fields.summary: Move Issue - issue does not adpot default security level in target project if one is selected.

fields.description: The text "Note that you can only see your own subscriptions for viewable filters" is currently not in a property file, it is hardcoded in ./jira/src/webapp/includes/panels/filter/managefilters_shared.jsp
fields.summary: string not localized

fields.description:
When selecting projects or issue types in the find issues dialog, this help text is displayed:

Projects / issue types were modified. Please click here to get updated versions, components and custom fields 

It took me quite a while to figure out what this means. I thought I had modified the project by clicking that link.

I suggest rewriting the help text perhaps like this:

"The new selected projects or issue types have different versions, components and custom fields. Click here to refresh the search option menu".

In addition, the overall look and feel of this help text looks more like a severe problem instead than a help text. Maybe the color should be changed to something more neutral, like gray.
fields.summary: help text difficult to understand

fields.description:
To reproduce this, store an arbitrary filter, then modify it and execute it again. The "Actions" section display a new link "Save".

Now modify your locale settings to "German" and click on the "Search issues" link again. The search link is no longer a link.

I tried a couple of other locales but that problem seems to be only with the german locale setting.

It works in 3.3 beta1 though.
fields.summary: Add latest German translation pack.

fields.description: When I modify one of my saved filters and click on the "Save" link, then the text  "Hello testing 1 2 3" is displayed in the save filter page.
fields.summary: weird string " Hello testing 1 2 3"

fields.description: When I modify one of my own saved filters and run the search, a link "filter operations" appear in the left navigation menu. Clicking on this link does not trigger any actions as far as I can see it.
fields.summary: Link "filter operations" does not work

fields.description: When I modify one of my own saved filters and run the search, a link "filter operations" appear in the left navigation menu. This text is not in the language property files, so it is not translateable.
fields.summary: "Filter operations" string not localized

fields.description:
When deleting the group Anyone, the confirmation text just says Group.
See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Group name missing when deleting group 'Anyone' from a permission scheme
Update devkit for JIRA 3.3
Create Issue transition not shown on 'view workflow steps' page

fields.description:
Hideable sections in issue navigator

You can show and hide various sections of the issue navigator by clicking on the green + - arrows
fields.summary: Hideable sections in issue navigator
Update plugin development kit & related tutorials (make sure they still work)

fields.description:
If you have a transition that updates a field (resolution for example) that is required, the message below is shown. "resolution=Resolution" doesn't really make much sense.

    * Unable to execute post workflow function. Issue may be in an inconsistent state. Please inform your system administrators immediately. Validation of the field 'resolution' failed: [] {resolution=Resolution is required.}
fields.summary: Unhelpful error message when checking fields after workflow transition

fields.description: If an issue has been assigned and state is set to "In Progress", the "assignee" field should not be modifiable to be "unassigned", because how can an issue be in progress when no one is working on it.
fields.summary: "In Progress" issue should not be able to be modified to be unassigned.

fields.description: A customer was requesting that an offlline client would be built for JIRA. I am not sure how this would work or how conflicts would be resolved but I wanted to capture this request.
fields.summary: Create an offline client for JIRA

fields.description: Is there a way to make the Excel output default the page setup to Landscape, rather than Portrait mode? I would think the vast majority of users would be OK with that.
fields.summary: Excel output should set Landscape mode

fields.description:
Occasionally, but not always, after a restart (or reboot of the server), the attachments flag is reset to OFF and indexing is off so that I am prompted to re-index. When we re-index and turn on again, all is fine, and it often endures restarts. So, the path must be right, and we've triple checked that anyway. Any ideas?
I found an old issue JRA-973, and we looked at the consoleon startup.. there were no errors. But the time we looked, it also came up fine.
fields.summary: attachments and indexing sometimes turns itself off

fields.description:
I put -2m To -2w to search for issues created between 2 months ago and 2 weeks ago. Is that not the correct way of using this interface? I got this message:

 There are errors with your search query on the left, please correct them before continuing
fields.summary: how do you use the new date picker?

fields.description:
Cannnot clear custom fields values

You can add a custom field value but you cannot remove them (edit them to null)
fields.summary: Cannnot clear custom fields values

fields.description:
If you use the Multi Select Searcher for select lists the search is not completed.  One error that occurs is:
2005-07-28 17:18:50,119 WARN [velocity] Could not determine type of iterator in #foreach loop  at [0,0] in template templates/plugins/fields/view-searcher/view-searcher-multioption.vm

From a support email:
-----------------------------
We have been working w/ Filters and noticed that listbox selections in the "Custom Fields" section in the filter sidebar are not maintained during the View or Edit processes.  This affects our "How Found", "QA Status" and "Severity" listboxes but not the dropdown boxes, radio button selections or text fields in this section.  It also does not affect the listboxes in the "Issue Attributes" section ("Issue Type", "Status", "Matching Priorities", etc.)

Whenever we try to Edit a query that includes "How Found" values, the "How Found" values are erased in the filter display 
 
To Reproduce
1. Create new filter for FSM project 
2. Select several values in the "How Found" Custom Fields box  (ie, Test Case, Regression Test) - can also try this with "QA Status" or "Severity" 
3. Click "View" button & review results.  Save filter. 
4. Click "Edit" link for that filter 
5. Scroll down to the "How Found" list - note that all values have been deselected.  
6. Clicking "Edit" should load the entire filter and all its settings. 
 
Whenever we create a query with "Custom Fields" listbox values and click "View", the listbox values are deselected.  
 
To Reproduce
1. Create new filter for "All Projects" 
2. Select several values in the "Severity" and "QA Status" fields 
3. Click "View" 
4. Look at the filter sidebar and scroll down to the "Custom Fields" section - the "Severity" and "QA Status" selections are no longer highlighted.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator has problems when Multi Select Searcher is used for Select List custom fields
JIRA CVS integration ignores initial import commits

fields.description:
The Created and Updated dates are displayed as DMY Format in the Issue Navigator but then when issue is opened, they are displayed as Day Format with time.  E.g. Friday 2:00am

Change the column view to be DMY time Format.  Do not use days (E.g. Monday)

Offending files are the corresponding System Field files.  Change Format.
fields.summary: Column view for Updated &  Created dates do not display times.

fields.description:
When the script below is entered into an issue description box, it will execute the next time a person tries to edit the issue:

 </textarea><script type="text/javascript">alert('you have been haxored');</script>
fields.summary: Allows cross-site scripting

fields.description:
I found I could not rename the field tab from "Field Tab" in the Assign Issue Screen. But then I thought - well maybe it isn't used anywhere, since functionality for screens on assigning issues isn't there yet. But.. then I saw that it is indeed used when Closing an issue (especially one that has been resolved). So, when closing an issue, the name "Field Tab" shows up and the screen has an Assign To dropdown but you can't rename it from the U.I.
Never one to give up though, I found a workaround. Add "Resolution" to the field tab, then you can rename it, and then remove "Resolution". The new name sticks.
fields.summary: cannot rename field tab for assign issue screen if only one field on the tab

fields.description:
I thought that in version 3.0.3, the preset filters "Assigned to Me" and "Reported by Me" didn't include Closed issues. But I see that since version 3.2.1 at least, these filters do include Closed issues. Can you clarify whether this has always been the case? Normally people don't want to include closed issues in their to-do list.
In fact I was quite sure this used to only show only Open, Unresolved issues, because I had to create a new filter "My Resolved Issues" to see them, since I rarely had "Open" issues assigned to me. These preset filters are pretty useless if they include Closed issues - especially for testers. Thanks.
fields.summary: preset filters is including closed issues
NPE out of issuenotfound.jsp
Have ability to show read-only fields on screens

fields.description:
When an issue is closed, any attempt to reopen it generates an error that says:

---------------------------------------
Form Errors:

    * Unable to execute post workflow function. Issue may be in an inconsistent state. Please inform your system administrators immediately. Validation of the field 'resolution' failed: [] {resolution=Resolution is required.}
---------------------------------------

In the log, there is an error, I've attached it.  I've also attached a screenshot of the error window, for
what that's worth.

Note that the item IS reopened despite the error message - it just gives an error.  If the resolution is changed 
on the "reopen" page, that is also ignored and the status will be whatever it was when the item was closed.

Looking at the workflow, I see that the first postcondition is this:

" The Resolution of the issue will be set to ."

Looks like a problem to me.  Of course, I can't edit the workflow, since it's in use, but I'm betting
that if I copy it and make that something reasonable, it will work.

Other things of note: I believe we have the Resolution field as a required field; I am going to 
change that to NOT required and see if that fixes it.  Plus, I'll see if copying the workflow and
changing that postcondition to a valid one helps.
fields.summary: Attempting to reopen an issue generates an error.

fields.description: we have reported a bug to this issue. Please help us to resolve it. ID 7427
fields.summary: Reports dissapear after the installation of pluggin "Graphical Project Gantt Chart Report"

fields.description:
We have installed the pluggin "Graphical Project Gantt Chart Report" from the JIRA Community site.

After this installation the report list box at the "browse project" page dissapears. If we dissable the plugin the report list appears again.

Attached find the system settings of our JIRA enterprise server.
fields.summary: Reports dissapear after the installation of pluggin "Graphical Project Gantt Chart Report"

fields.description:
When creating an issue on your support site, there is information below "Environment" and "Description". e.g.:
"Please include a full description of how to replicate the problem you are experiencing. This may be the steps to replicate, or the data that caused the problem."
Where do I set that up on my system? I know it must be there, but I can't seem to find it. or is this hard-coded in a properties file somewhere, only?
fields.summary: how do you set descriptions for standard fields?

fields.description: I suspect this has something to do with the data JIRA is trying to display from the description of JRA-4134 - perhaps the need is to "escape" text description for Excel, in a similar way you had to for XML. If you perform a search that includes this issue (e.g. Text: "export excel original active" Component: "Import/Export") and create an Excel list, you'll see the top of the spreadsheet has bits from the above mentioned issue's description. If you remove description from your view, the Current fields export no longer has the problem. Of course, the All fields export will always have the problem.
fields.summary: export to excel causes odd data

fields.description: I have several filters that are sorted by Date Updated (descending). However, it only shows the date, and not the time. Is there a way to get the time to show up on date fields? There's plenty of room considering other columns' wrapping leaves a lot of blank space below. Curiously, the filter subscription does show the time.
fields.summary: issue navigator doesn't show time in date last updated

fields.description: Currently the link issue popup is quite slow - we look up *all* the issues.  We should move this to use the newer searching code, which is much faster.
fields.summary: Improve performance of link issue popup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7467].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 21  2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Otto Ruettinger
Principal Product Manager, JIRA
oruettinger (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

We have different customers using our JIRA-Enterprise instance.

If we activate the user browser on the find issues screen, all users appear in the browser.

This is a problem for us, because users from customer company A can see users from customer company B.

It would be nice if only users are displayed which have access to the projects the current user has access to.
fields.summary: Show only users with project access rights in Find Issues-User Browser
Let NonQuotedCommentHandler use pluggable regular expressions to separate quoated message part.

fields.summary: Mantis importer: search page breaks after import

fields.description:
When using the Jelly Runner, if there's a filename in the filename field *and* the initial/default Jelly code in the textarea, the Jelly code in the textarea is used, and the filename is ignored. Thus you get a result message that says it worked, but your filename wasn't used. It's confusing.

One fix would be to make that initial Jelly code disappear if the filename field were changed (some JavaScript magic) or maybe just make that field disabled in HTML in that situation. Alternatively the server could just print an error message and refuse to do anything if there's something in both fields.
fields.summary: Jelly runner should refuse to run if there's text in both fields
